text: Kevon whenever there are tensions on the
borders it's very difficult to know what
is to be believed have you managed to
get any clarification of what's
happening well a single shell that is
believed to be from a rocket propelled
artillery landed across the border and
the South Korean military fired back
with dozens of its own artillery fire
the shell is believed to have landed on
a hill across the border and no
casualties have been reported the
government in Seoul has said the
exchange of fire has ceased but the
military in the South has gone into its
highest alert residence near the border
have been ordered to evacuate an
emergency security meeting has been
scheduled at the presidential office
where further actions will be discussed
what is the status quo at the moment
between the north and south is this at
these incidents because of perhaps
trigger-happy or nervous soldiers on the
northern side of the border or is it
intended well it all began last week
when South Korea started loudspeaker
broth propaganda broadcasts along the
DMZ after soldiers were maimed while
patrolling the border the government in
Seoul have believes the mines were
deliberately planted by the north the
North Korean military has denied this
claim and warned that it would attack
South Korean positions if the propaganda
broadcast does not stop and what do we
think will happen now what what is the
usual state of play when tensions build
up like this do they tend to simmer down
and calm down well it's always the
danger of escalation isn't it at the
moment the officials in Seoul are
putting their heads together trying to
decide what to do next and perhaps the
ball may be in North Korea's Court but
at the moment the military exchange has
ceased and we'll have to see what comes
next
